rootCause: The Avahi parser left trailing dots on hostnames and TXT leader values when avahi-browse emitted a domain of 'local.', so the mDNS self-check never matched the bootstrap advertisement for the local node.
resolution:
Trim trailing dots, normalise case, and reuse the hostname normaliser for both resolved hosts and TXT leader fields so bootstrap self-checks accept Avahi responses with domain suffixes.

2025-12-08 follow-up: Bound avahi-publish-service with -H to the FQDN, added a 1s self-check delay, and capture output in /tmp/sugar-publish.log to prevent bootstrap races.
Quick triage:
- avahi-browse -rt _k3s-sugar-dev._tcp --parsable | sed -n '1,80p'
- pgrep -a avahi-publish || true
- sed -n '1,120p' /tmp/sugar-publish.log || true
